lead_paragraph: This grand café, the National, has been interpreted in a very conservative style by David Rockwell with cream walls, dark furniture, leather banquettes and geometric tile; and by Geoffrey Zakarian, whose mainstream menu features oysters, mussels, caesar salad, a few sandwiches, steak frites, roast chicken and trout, for a place that is open morning until night. (See: Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner and Dessert (pdfs)). The space had previously housed restaurants by Larry Forgione and then Terrance Brennan, and the hotel was once the Beverly; The Benjamin, 557 Lexington Avenue (50th Street), 212-715-2400, thebenjamin.com.
snippet: This grand café, the National, has been interpreted in a very conservative style by David Rockwell.

headline.main: A New Restaurant for the Benjamin Hotel

abstract: This grand café, the National, has been interpreted in a very conservative style by David Rockwell.
